Hot Cargo.definition: products made by nonunion employees or by employees considered to be treated unfairly by their employer adj

1.1: products made by nonunion employees or by employees considered to be treated unfairly by their employer

2.1: of, relating to, or being an agreement between labor and an employer barring the employer from using or otherwise dealing with the products of another employer whose employees are nonunion
2.note: Hot cargo agreements, clauses, and provisions were outlawed by the Labor Management Reporting and Disclosure Act.
